attributes.action: Bravery medals for medically retired Prison Officers. Upper or lower tier.
attributes.additional_details: Prison officers who have been medically retired due to injuries received in the line of duty no matter how long ago deserve to receive a bravery medal.  even though their hearts are racing, they feel physically sick , their legs feel weak they are shaking like anything and they are scared. They do their jobs every day and when injured doing their duty they deserve a bravery medal and recognition like any other service. Its time Prison Officers received some recognition they protect us all.
attributes.background: Every day there are brave men and women walking into places that can only be explained as beyond the imagination of normal people. Its like walking from one world into another world where anything can happen at anytime . They are protecting everyone and serving  Queen, Community and country.

rejection.details:
The Government will only accept individual nominations for civilian gallantry, not petitions, so we can’t publish your petition.

You can nominate someone who has made an exceptional contribution to the response to the coronavirus (COVID-19) crisis in the UK.

To submit a nomination for an honour, visit: https://www.gov.uk/honours/nominate-someone-for-coronavirus-work
